Package com.rapidminer.belt.transform

Class RowTransformer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rapidminer.belt.transform.RowTransformer
  • public final class RowTransformer
extends java.lang.Object
    Supplies transformation methods (different kinds of apply and reduce methods) starting from the given transformationColumns. Depending on how the transformation columns should be read (numeric, categorical or objects) the right method (e.g. applyNumericTo or reduceCategorical) must be selected.
    Author:
    Gisa Meier

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      RowTransformer​(java.util.List<Column> transformationColumns)
      Creates a new starting point for a transformation based on the given columns
      RowTransformer​(java.util.List<Column> transformationColumns, boolean validate)
      Creates a new starting point for a transformation based on the given columns

      RowTransformer callback​(java.util.function.DoubleConsumer callback)
      Specifies a progress callback function.
      <T> T reduceCategorical​(java.util.function.Supplier<T> supplier, java.util.function.BiConsumer<T,​CategoricalRow> reducer, java.util.function.BiConsumer<T,​T> combiner, Context context)
      Performs a mutable reduction operation on the rows of the Column.Category.CATEGORICAL transformation columns.
      <T> T reduceMixed​(java.util.function.Supplier<T> supplier, java.util.function.BiConsumer<T,​MixedRow> reducer, java.util.function.BiConsumer<T,​T> combiner, Context context)
      Performs a mutable reduction operation on the rows of the transformation columns.
      <T> T reduceNumeric​(java.util.function.Supplier<T> supplier, java.util.function.BiConsumer<T,​NumericRow> reducer, java.util.function.BiConsumer<T,​T> combiner, Context context)
      Performs a mutable reduction operation on the rows of the numeric-readable transformation columns.
      <T,​R>
      T      		 reduceObjects​(java.lang.Class<R> type, java.util.function.Supplier<T> supplier, java.util.function.BiConsumer<T,​ObjectRow<R>> reducer, java.util.function.BiConsumer<T,​T> combiner, Context context)
      Performs a mutable reduction operation on the rows of the object-readable transformation columns.

      • RowTransformer

        public RowTransformer​(java.util.List<Column> transformationColumns,
                      boolean validate)
        Creates a new starting point for a transformation based on the given columns
        Parameters:
        transformationColumns - the columns to start the transformation from, must be all of the same length
        validate - whether the input columns require validation
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the list is or contains null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the list is empty

      • workload

        public RowTransformer workload​(Workload workload)
        Specifies the expected Workload per data point.
        Parameters:
        workload - the workload
        Returns:
        this transform

      • callback

        public RowTransformer callback​(java.util.function.DoubleConsumer callback)
        Specifies a progress callback function. The progress is reported as single double value where zero and one indicate 0% and 100% progress respectively. The value Double.NaN is used to indicate indeterminate states.
        Parameters:
        callback - the progress callback
        Returns:
        this transform

      • applyNumericToReal

        public NumericBuffer applyNumericToReal​(java.util.function.ToDoubleFunction<NumericRow> operator,
                                        Context context)
        Applies the given operator of arbitrary arity to the numeric readable transformation columns returning the result in a new real NumericBuffer. Depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point, the computation might be performed in parallel.
        Parameters:
        operator - the operator to apply to each tuple (see NumericRow)
        context - the execution context to use
        Returns:
        a buffer containing the result of the mapping
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is null
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if any of the transformation columns is not Column.Capability.NUMERIC_READABLE

                                           java.util.function.ToDoubleFunction<ObjectRow<T>> operator,
                                           Context context)
        Applies the given operator of arbitrary arity to the object-readable transformation columns returning the result in a new real NumericBuffer. Depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point, the computation might be performed in parallel.

        T - type of objects in the columns
        Parameters:

      • applyMixedToReal

        public NumericBuffer applyMixedToReal​(java.util.function.ToDoubleFunction<MixedRow> operator,
                                      Context context)
        Applies the given operator of arbitrary arity to the transformation columns returning the result in a new real NumericBuffer. Depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point, the computation might be performed in parallel.

        This method uses an operator starting from a MixedRow which allows to read the row in different ways. This is not as performant as reading the row only in one specific way. So whenever possible it is recommended to use the methods applyNumericToReal(java.util.function.ToDoubleFunction<com.rapidminer.belt.reader.NumericRow>, com.rapidminer.belt.execution.Context), applyCategoricalToReal(java.util.function.ToDoubleFunction<com.rapidminer.belt.reader.CategoricalRow>, com.rapidminer.belt.execution.Context) or applyObjectToReal(java.lang.Class<T>, java.util.function.ToDoubleFunction<com.rapidminer.belt.reader.ObjectRow<T>>, com.rapidminer.belt.execution.Context) instead.

        Parameters:
        operator - the operator to apply to each tuple (see MixedRow)
        context - the execution context to use
        Returns:
        a buffer containing the result of the mapping
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is null

      • applyMixedToInteger53Bit

        public NumericBuffer applyMixedToInteger53Bit​(java.util.function.ToDoubleFunction<MixedRow> operator,
                                              Context context)
        Applies the given operator of arbitrary arity to the transformation columns returning the result in a new NumericBuffer of type Column.TypeId.INTEGER_53_BIT. Depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point, the computation might be performed in parallel.

        This method uses an operator starting from a MixedRow which allows to read the row in different ways. This is not as performant as reading the row only in one specific way. So whenever possible it is recommended to use the methods applyNumericToInteger53Bit(java.util.function.ToDoubleFunction<com.rapidminer.belt.reader.NumericRow>, com.rapidminer.belt.execution.Context), applyCategoricalToInteger53Bit(java.util.function.ToDoubleFunction<com.rapidminer.belt.reader.CategoricalRow>, com.rapidminer.belt.execution.Context) or applyObjectToInteger53Bit(java.lang.Class<T>, java.util.function.ToDoubleFunction<com.rapidminer.belt.reader.ObjectRow<T>>, com.rapidminer.belt.execution.Context) instead.

        Parameters:
        operator - the operator to apply to each tuple (see MixedRow)
        context - the execution context to use
        Returns:
        a buffer containing the result of the mapping
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is null

      • applyObjectToNominal

        public <R> Int32NominalBuffer applyObjectToNominal​(java.lang.Class<R> type,
                                                   java.util.function.Function<ObjectRow<R>,​java.lang.String> operator,
                                                   Context context)
        Applies the given operator of arbitrary arity to the object-readable transformation columns returning the result in a new Int32NominalBuffer of type Column.TypeId.NOMINAL. Depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point, the computation might be performed in parallel.
        Type Parameters:
        R - type of objects in the columns
        Parameters:
        operator - the operator to apply to each tuple (see ObjectRow)
        type - the type of the objects in the columns
        context - the execution context to use
        Returns:
        a buffer containing the result of the mapping
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is null
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if any of the transformation columns is not Column.Capability.OBJECT_READABLE
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the objects in the transformation columns cannot be read as the given type

      • applyObjectToNominal

        public <R> NominalBuffer applyObjectToNominal​(java.lang.Class<R> type,
                                              java.util.function.Function<ObjectRow<R>,​java.lang.String> operator,
                                              int maxNumberOfValues,
                                              Context context)
        Applies the given operator of arbitrary arity to the object-readable transformation columns returning the result in a new NominalBuffer of type Column.TypeId.NOMINAL. The format of the target buffer is derived from given maxNumberOfValues parameter. Depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point, the computation might be performed in parallel.
        Type Parameters:
        R - type of objects in the columns
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the objects in the columns
        operator - the operator to apply to each tuple (see ObjectRow)
        maxNumberOfValues - the maximal number of different values generated by the operator. Decides the format of the buffer.
        context - the execution context to use
        Returns:
        a buffer containing the result of the mapping
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is null
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if any of the transformation columns is not Column.Capability.OBJECT_READABLE
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the objects in the transformation columns cannot be read as the given type or if more different values are supplied than supported by the buffer format calculated from the maxNumberOfValues

      • applyCategoricalToNominal

        public Int32NominalBuffer applyCategoricalToNominal​(java.util.function.Function<CategoricalRow,​java.lang.String> operator,
                                                    Context context)
        Applies the given operator of arbitrary arity to the categorical transformation columns returning the result in a new Int32NominalBuffer of type Column.TypeId.NOMINAL. Depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point, the computation might be performed in parallel.
        Parameters:
        operator - the operator to apply to each tuple (see CategoricalRow)
        context - the execution context to use
        Returns:
        a buffer containing the result of the mapping
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if any of the transformation columns is not Column.Category.CATEGORICAL
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the objects in the transformation columns cannot be read as the given type

        public NominalBuffer applyCategoricalToNominal​(java.util.function.Function<CategoricalRow,​java.lang.String> operator,
                                               int maxNumberOfValues,
                                               Context context)
        Applies the given operator of arbitrary arity to the categorical transformation columns returning the result in a new NominalBuffer of type Column.TypeId.NOMINAL. The format of the target buffer is derived from given maxNumberOfValues parameter. Depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point, the computation might be performed in parallel.
        Parameters:
        operator - the operator to apply to each tuple (see CategoricalRow)
        maxNumberOfValues - the maximal number of different values generated by the operator. Decides the format of the buffer.
        context - the execution context to use
        Returns:
        a buffer containing the result of the mapping
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is null
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if any of the transformation columns is not Column.Category.CATEGORICAL
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if more different values are supplied than supported by the buffer format calculated from the maxNumberOfValues

      • applyNumericToNominal

        public NominalBuffer applyNumericToNominal​(java.util.function.Function<NumericRow,​java.lang.String> operator,
                                           int maxNumberOfValues,
                                           Context context)
        Applies the given operator of arbitrary arity to the numeric-readable transformation columns returning the result in a new NominalBuffer of type Column.TypeId.NOMINAL. The format of the target buffer is derived from given maxNumberOfValues parameter. Depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point, the computation might be performed in parallel.
        Parameters:
        operator - the operator to apply to each tuple (see NumericRow)
        maxNumberOfValues - the maximal number of different values generated by the operator. Decides the format of the buffer.
        context - the execution context to use
        Returns:
        a buffer containing the result of the mapping
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is null
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if any of the transformation columns is not Column.Capability.NUMERIC_READABLE
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if more different values are supplied than supported by the buffer format calculated from the maxNumberOfValues

      • applyMixedToNominal

        public Int32NominalBuffer applyMixedToNominal​(java.util.function.Function<MixedRow,​java.lang.String> operator,
                                              Context context)
        Applies the given operator of arbitrary arity to the transformation columns returning the result in a new Int32NominalBuffer of type Column.TypeId.NOMINAL. Depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point, the computation might be performed in parallel.

        This method uses an operator starting from a MixedRow which allows to read the row in different ways. This is not as performant as reading the row only in one specific way. So whenever possible it is recommended to use the methods applyNumericToNominal(java.util.function.Function<com.rapidminer.belt.reader.NumericRow, java.lang.String>, com.rapidminer.belt.execution.Context), applyCategoricalToNominal(java.util.function.Function<com.rapidminer.belt.reader.CategoricalRow, java.lang.String>, com.rapidminer.belt.execution.Context) or applyObjectToNominal(java.lang.Class<R>, java.util.function.Function<com.rapidminer.belt.reader.ObjectRow<R>, java.lang.String>, com.rapidminer.belt.execution.Context) instead.

        Parameters:
        operator - the operator to apply to each tuple (see MixedRow)
        context - the execution context to use
        Returns:
        a buffer containing the result of the mapping
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is null

      • applyMixedToNominal

        public NominalBuffer applyMixedToNominal​(java.util.function.Function<MixedRow,​java.lang.String> operator,
                                         int maxNumberOfValues,
                                         Context context)
        Applies the given operator of arbitrary arity to the transformation columns returning the result in a new NominalBuffer of type Column.TypeId.NOMINAL. The format of the target buffer is derived from given maxNumberOfValues parameter. Depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point, the computation might be performed in parallel.

        This method uses an operator starting from a MixedRow which allows to read the row in different ways. This is not as performant as reading the row only in one specific way. So whenever possible it is recommended to use the methods applyNumericToNominal(java.util.function.Function<com.rapidminer.belt.reader.NumericRow, java.lang.String>, com.rapidminer.belt.execution.Context), applyCategoricalToNominal(java.util.function.Function<com.rapidminer.belt.reader.CategoricalRow, java.lang.String>, com.rapidminer.belt.execution.Context) or applyObjectToNominal(java.lang.Class<R>, java.util.function.Function<com.rapidminer.belt.reader.ObjectRow<R>, java.lang.String>, com.rapidminer.belt.execution.Context) instead.

        Parameters:
        operator - the operator to apply to each tuple (see MixedRow)
        maxNumberOfValues - the maximal number of different values generated by the operator. Decides the format of the buffer.
        context - the execution context to use
        Returns:
        a buffer containing the result of the mapping
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if more different values are supplied than supported by the buffer format calculated from the maxNumberOfValues

      • reduceNumeric

        public <T> T reduceNumeric​(java.util.function.Supplier<T> supplier,
                           java.util.function.BiConsumer<T,​NumericRow> reducer,
                           java.util.function.BiConsumer<T,​T> combiner,
                           Context context)
        Performs a mutable reduction operation on the rows of the numeric-readable transformation columns. A mutable reduction is one in which the reduced value is a mutable result container, such as an ArrayList, and elements are incorporated by updating the state of the result rather than by replacing the result. This produces a result equivalent to: 
        
     T result = supplier.get();
     NumericRowReader reader = new NumericRowReader(transformationColumns);
     while (reader.hasRemaining){
     	   reader.move();
         reducer.accept(result, reader);
     }
     return result;
        but is not constrained to execute sequentially.

        The reduction is executed via the given context and automatically parallelized depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point.

        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the result
        Parameters:
        supplier - a function that creates a new result container. In case of a parallel execution, this function may be called multiple times and must return a new instance each time.
        reducer - a stateless function for incorporating an additional element into a result
        combiner - an associative, stateless function for combining two values, which must be compatible with the accumulator function
        context - the execution context
        Returns:
        the result of the reduction
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is or the supplier returns null
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if any of the transformation columns is not Column.Capability.NUMERIC_READABLE
        See Also:
        Stream.collect(Supplier, BiConsumer, BiConsumer)

      • reduceCategorical

        public <T> T reduceCategorical​(java.util.function.Supplier<T> supplier,
                               java.util.function.BiConsumer<T,​CategoricalRow> reducer,
                               java.util.function.BiConsumer<T,​T> combiner,
                               Context context)
        Performs a mutable reduction operation on the rows of the Column.Category.CATEGORICAL transformation columns. A mutable reduction is one in which the reduced value is a mutable result container, such as an ArrayList, and elements are incorporated by updating the state of the result rather than by replacing the result. This produces a result equivalent to: 
        
     T result = supplier.get();
     CategoricalRowReader reader = new CategoricalRowReader(transformationColumns);
     while (reader.hasRemaining){
     	   reader.move();
         reducer.accept(result, reader);
     }
     return result;
        but is not constrained to execute sequentially.

        The reduction is executed via the given context and automatically parallelized depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point.

        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the result
        Parameters:
        supplier - a function that creates a new result container. In case of a parallel execution, this function may be called multiple times and must return a new instance each time.
        reducer - a stateless function for incorporating an additional element into a result
        combiner - an associative, stateless function for combining two values, which must be compatible with the accumulator function
        context - the execution context
        Returns:
        the result of the reduction
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is or the supplier returns null
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if any of the transformation columns is not Column.Category.CATEGORICAL
        See Also:
        Stream.collect(Supplier, BiConsumer, BiConsumer)

      • reduceObjects

        public <T,​R> T reduceObjects​(java.lang.Class<R> type,
                                   java.util.function.Supplier<T> supplier,
                                   java.util.function.BiConsumer<T,​ObjectRow<R>> reducer,
                                   java.util.function.BiConsumer<T,​T> combiner,
                                   Context context)
        Performs a mutable reduction operation on the rows of the object-readable transformation columns. A mutable reduction is one in which the reduced value is a mutable result container, such as an ArrayList, and elements are incorporated by updating the state of the result rather than by replacing the result. This produces a result equivalent to: 
        
     T result = supplier.get();
     ObjectRowReader<R> reader = new ObjectRowReader<>(transformationColumns, type);
     while (reader.hasRemaining){
     	   reader.move();
         reducer.accept(result, reader);
     }
     return result;
        but is not constrained to execute sequentially.

        The reduction is executed via the given context and automatically parallelized depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point.

        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the result
        R - type of objects in the columns
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the objects in the columns
        supplier - a function that creates a new result container. In case of a parallel execution, this function may be called multiple times and must return a new instance each time.
        reducer - a stateless function for incorporating an additional element into a result
        combiner - an associative, stateless function for combining two values, which must be compatible with the accumulator function
        context - the execution context
        Returns:
        the result of the reduction
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is or the supplier returns null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if type is not a super type of the element type of all of the columns
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the one of the columns is not Column.Capability.OBJECT_READABLE
        See Also:
        Stream.collect(Supplier, BiConsumer, BiConsumer)

      • reduceMixed

        public <T> T reduceMixed​(java.util.function.Supplier<T> supplier,
                         java.util.function.BiConsumer<T,​MixedRow> reducer,
                         java.util.function.BiConsumer<T,​T> combiner,
                         Context context)
        Performs a mutable reduction operation on the rows of the transformation columns. A mutable reduction is one in which the reduced value is a mutable result container, such as an ArrayList, and elements are incorporated by updating the state of the result rather than by replacing the result. This produces a result equivalent to: 
        
     T result = supplier.get();
     MixedRowReader reader = new MixedRowReader(transformationColumns);
     while (reader.hasRemaining){
     	   reader.move();
         reducer.accept(result, reader);
     }
     return result;
        but is not constrained to execute sequentially.

        The reduction is executed via the given context and automatically parallelized depending on the input size and the specified workload per data-point.

        This method uses a reducer working with a MixedRow which allows to read the row in different ways. This is not as performant as reading the row only in one specific way. So whenever possible it is recommended to use the methods reduceCategorical(java.util.function.Supplier<T>, java.util.function.BiConsumer<T, com.rapidminer.belt.reader.CategoricalRow>, java.util.function.BiConsumer<T, T>, com.rapidminer.belt.execution.Context), reduceNumeric(java.util.function.Supplier<T>, java.util.function.BiConsumer<T, com.rapidminer.belt.reader.NumericRow>, java.util.function.BiConsumer<T, T>, com.rapidminer.belt.execution.Context) or reduceObjects(java.lang.Class<R>, java.util.function.Supplier<T>, java.util.function.BiConsumer<T, com.rapidminer.belt.reader.ObjectRow<R>>, java.util.function.BiConsumer<T, T>, com.rapidminer.belt.execution.Context) instead.

        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the result
        Parameters:
        supplier - a function that creates a new result container. In case of a parallel execution, this function may be called multiple times and must return a new instance each time.
        reducer - a stateless function for incorporating an additional element into a result
        combiner - an associative, stateless function for combining two values, which must be compatible with the accumulator function
        context - the execution context
        Returns:
        the result of the reduction
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is or the supplier returns null
        See Also:
        Stream.collect(Supplier, BiConsumer, BiConsumer)
